CatDescriptText: W.C. Haas, salesman, Dravosburg, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 30, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think single or married women make better teachers for elementary grades in public schools?  Do you think that married men should teach in elementary grades?" answer reads: "Providing that they are not too old, married women, in my opinion, are better teachers seemingly because they have a better understanding of children...I think that it's all right for a man to teach other classes besides shop."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of W.C. Haas wearing light colored shirt with pen in breast pocket and dark necktie with geometric design, standing in front of Marsh Weeling, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
